complexity.business: 1: Pure refactoring with no functional changes
complexity.coordination: 1: Template-only changes, no backend coordination needed

outcomes.performance_impact: No performance impact, same CSS content served via separate files

summary: Split inline CSS from base.html into separate component-based CSS files for better maintainability
root_cause: All CSS was inline in base.html making it difficult to maintain and organize styles

solution.approach: Extract CSS by UI component into separate files with proper linking
key_changes: css/base.css: Reset styles and common base styles
css/ui-messages-list.css: Message list and tool notification styles
css/ui-user-input.css: Input area and button styles

validation: Visually verified file structure matches requested organization

gotchas.issue: Need to ensure CSS file paths are correct relative to HTML file location
gotchas.solution: Used relative paths 'css/' from templates directory

lesson: Component-based CSS organization improves maintainability without affecting functionality
